availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James N. Barnes (Carter County, Kentucky, student and gentleman)

body.p: Carter County, Kentucky, student and gentleman. Kentucky native. Student in Carter County in 1850. Household owned nineteen enslaved persons in Carter County in 1850. Gentleman in Carter County in 1860. Owned eighteen enslaved persons in Carter County in 1860. Household owned forty five slaves in Carter County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, District 2, p. 217B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, District 2, p. 914

Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, Precinct, p. 96A
